data.contentText:
Consider risk factors (Same as for neonatal sepsis). 

Remember infections are often not localised and may spread rapidly

metadata.text1:
Postition airway & suction
If sats < 90% in air put on oxygen
If > 1 kg consider CPAP according to TRY algorithm
metadata.text2:
If breathing 60-80 bpm use cup/NGT
If needing CPAP use OGT
If breathing > 80bpm consider IV fluids
metadata.text3:
Investigations: FBC including differential

Blood cultures- take BEFORE commencing antibiotics if possible
Remember to write the NeoTree number on the bottle and form (first 3 and last 3 digits of full number)

Lumbar puncture if signs of meningism
CRP if available. 

Commence: X pen 50000 iu/kg/dose 12 hourly
gentamicin 5 mg/kg/dose 24 hourly 

Reduce gentamicin to 4 mg/kg/dose if <2000g

Stop at 48 hours if Cultures/investigations negative AND symptoms resolved.

data.title: MANAGEMENT
